Paragraph.Text: The Track Junction is the key to enabling intelligent distribution of resources across your entire fortress. Junctions link to each other to form a transport grid that freight carts can navigate to freight station destinations. With these it is possible to connect every production center, near and far, with a supply of resources from anywhere in the fortress.

The track junction's color will change to reflect the number of registered connections. Red indicates no connections have been registered, orange indicates 1, yellow 2, green 3, and blue indicates all 4 routes are connected.
It is perfectly valid for a junction path to lead back to itself. A connection can lead to a station, turn the cart around with a buffer, and return to the original junction and register as a valid connection. Closed loops that do not end at a junction however are forbidden.
Currently, connections are only recognized as broken when a junction, station, or depot is removed. If a track connected to a junction is modified or removed the junction will need to be replaced or reset to refresh the connections. If a connection is broken without refreshing the junction carts will continue to attempt to travel the broken route! Press Q on a junction to reset the track connections. This is advisable after any track layout change.
